page.title: 16Staploe, Shopping
page.content: There is no retail outlet in Staploe parish. Of the original 6 public houses, the last 3 have closed since the war. The Three Horseshoes in Staploe survived longest by selling confectionary and cigarettes. The nearest shop is in Eaton Socon. There is one bus from Duloe and Staploe to St. Neots, on Thursday (market day) and none from Honeydon. Everyone, therefore depends on deliveries, a car or neighbours. Milk is delivered on alternate days. A baker calls 3 times a week carrying some groceries, a mobile shop once a week. Duloe and staploe now have a wet fish delivery which has not so far reached Honeydon.Newspapers are delivered daily from Sharnbrook and there is one postal delivery. An ice cream van with sweets and cigarettes calls twice a week. The library calls fortnightly.
